summary: This is an email chain between attorneys regarding the preservation and review of video footage from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) related to the case of Jeffrey Epstein. It involves communication between defense attorneys and federal prosecutors about obtaining the video for review.

persons.name: Bruce Barket

connections.description: Both are attorneys at the same law firm, Barket, Epstein, Kearon, Aldea & LoTurco LLP.
Both are attorneys communicating about legal case matters regarding MCC video.
Both are attorneys included in the same email chain about legal case matters.

events.title: Email Correspondence About MCC Video
events.description: Email exchange between attorneys regarding the preservation and planned review of video footage from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: Video footage from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) was preserved upon request and attorneys were working to obtain a copy.
The video was to be made available for review at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
Review of the video was delayed until after the New Year due to key personnel being out of the office.
The communication involves both defense attorneys and federal prosecutors coordinating on evidence review.
The document shows legal procedures following Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody regarding preservation of evidence.
